gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: WRF model outputs from the 2-km resolution Sydney experiment (v1.0)

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: ARC Centre of Excellence for Climate System Science (ARCCSS)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model outputs from high-resolution (2-km) climate simulations over Sydney performed by Dr Daniel Argueso from the ARC Centre of Excellence for Climate System Science (ARCCSS). The WRF model is a regional climate model used to simulate the climate over a limited region at high spatial resolution. It was used to simulate the climate of Sydney under present (1990-2009) and future climate conditions (2040-2059) using land cover information from the New South Wales (NSW) Office of Environment and Heritage (OEH). An additional future simulation was performed with future projected expansion of urban areas in Sydney. All three simulations were completed to study the combined impact of urban expansion and climate change on temperature, vapor pressure and heat stress at local scales. Version 1.0 of this dataset includes daily maximum and minimum values of simplified wet-bulb globe temperature (W), as well as the temperature and vapor pressure used to calculate such daily extremes of W.
Weather Research and Forecasting model website: http://www.wrf-model.org/index.php
ARCCSS CMS wiki: http://climate-cms.unsw.wikispaces.net/ARCCSS+published+datasets

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The purpose of this dataset is to provide current and future simulation of Sydney climate using detailed land cover information as an input. One simulation was performed with future projected expansion of urban areas in Sydney

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Dataset is archived on NCI tape system (ua8 project) and on the CCRC/UNSW servers

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: Dataset cannot be used commercially, see license details

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: NetCDF libraries, various scientific packages and climate operators, as well as model codes that are already available at the NCI node
NetCDF libraries, various scientific packages and climate operators, as well as model codes that are already available at the NCI node

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Given the common format and the extent of the data, other researchers could easily use it for different purposes, across different platforms

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Argueso D, Evans JP, Pitman AJ, Di Luca A. Effects of City Expansion on Heat Stress under Climate Change Conditions. Ebi KL, ed. PLoS ONE. 2015;10(2):e0117066.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Data files are CF 1.6 and ACDD 1.3 compliant and have a md5 checksum for the main variables stored as attribute in the files. Routine checks for corruption will be performed regularly

http://dapds00.nci.org.au/thredds/catalog/ua8/ARCCSS_Data-1/WRF_Sydney2k/catalog.html?dataset=ua8-1/WRF_Sydney2k/readme.txt\r\nReadme file in /g/data1/ua8/ARCCSS_Data/WRF_Sydney2k/readme.txt\r\nPublication describing data: Argueso D, Evans JP, Pitman AJ, Di Luca A.
